title: Data centres are wary of sustainability push in govt’s AI mission GPU tender
description: As per the new clause introduced by the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY) in a corrigendum to the bid issued in the last week of September, a bidder must confirm that the PUE for the data centres from which AI services on cloud would be delivered is not more than 1.35.
content: The government’s push for sustainability in the IndiaAI Mission graphics processing units (GPU) tender – requiring bidders to have power usage effectiveness (PUE) of less than 1.35 – has data centres worried because they will have to increase capital expenditure and consequently pass the cost to customers to achieve that.The government through the tender seeks to set up public AI cloud infrastructure with 10,000 or more GPU capacity in a public-private partnership model.PUE is a metric that measures how efficiently a data centre uses energy. It is calculated by dividing the total amount of power used by a data centre by the amount of power used by its computing equipment. A lower PUE ratio indicates better energy efficiency.As per the new clause introduced by the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY) in a corrigendum to the bid issued in the last week of September, a bidder must confirm that the PUE for the data centres from which AI services on cloud would be delivered is not more than 1.35.
